messages.content:
6️⃣ Identity in agentic systems 🔐
"How do you prove your identity in an agentic world ? Considering developments in payments, what solutions can be envisioned to ensure trust? Blockchain, other alternatives " ?

7️⃣ Periodic table of ML 🧬
In a recent MIT weekly news, it referred to a periodic table of machine learning that shows how more than 20 classical algorithms are connected. The new framework sheds light on how scientists could fuse strategies from different methods to improve existing AI models or come up with new ones. link to article is https://news.mit.edu/2025/machine-learning-periodic-table-could-fuel-ai-discovery-0423
🙋‍♀️Question here is can you walk us through this AI periodic table and demonstrate how one might use it ?

8️⃣ OpenAI x Jony Ive reaction 💼
Q. Do you have initial thoughts on the OpenAI acquisition of Jony Ive’s Startup IO for $6.5Bn this week?

9️⃣ AI agents: reliability & flexibility 🧩
What’s the current state of AI agents in terms of reliability and safety? I’m curious to understand whether agents are already trustworthy enough to be deployed for specific tasks (like assistance, automation, or analysis), or if there are still major limitations to keep in mind.
Also, to what extent can an agent handle different types of functions or adapt to new contexts without losing accuracy? How flexible are they really when it comes to performing a variety of tasks?

🔟 Multi-agent governance & safety ⚖️
What will be the key challenges and, therefore, necessary aspects of governance and guardrails to ensure trust, compliance, and safety (e.g. regarding authentication and authorization for payments) – especially when multiple agents interact?

1️⃣ AI in healthcare layers & trust 🧢
On the emerging AI abstraction pyramid—from foundational models to agents to domain-specific applications—where do healthcare systems fit, and what technical and ethical safeguards are essential at each layer to ensure medical accuracy, accountability, and patient trust (both in physical diagnosis and in mental-health chatbots)?

2️⃣ Cognitive offloading & AI 🧠
How do we balance AI and cognitive offloading?

3️⃣ AI ROI: probabilistic modeling 📊
Q: Given that most organizations struggle with AI ROI measurement. What emerging best practices are you seeing in industry for probabilistic ROI modeling that accounts for AI-specific uncertainties?

4️⃣ Real vs FOMO transformation 🌀
Many organizations label ‘AI digital transformation’ what in practice is little more than swapping Google for ChatGPT. How can enterprises recognize when they’re genuinely transforming, rather than just adding AI to outdated workflows and for FOMO?

5️⃣ Self-teaching AI & human oversight 🤖
As self-teaching AI systems like Tsinghua University’s “Absolute Zero” begin to generate and solve tasks independently of human data, are we approaching a paradigm where human oversight becomes symbolic rather than substantive—and if so, what new frameworks of accountability and trust must we imagine for a future where AI evolves beyond our comprehension?

6️⃣ Measuring AI ROI in creativity 🎨
What frameworks are you using to evaluate AI ROI for this community?
And a broader question: what frameworks could be used to evaluate AI ROI beyond the typical productivity metrics, in creative industries where value is harder to quantify?

7️⃣ Leading communities in GenAI era 🧭
How do you lead communities in the GenAI age?
Any tips or tricks which can be shared?

8️⃣ Community roadmap: next 12–18 months 🛣️
Where do you see the Gen AI Global community in the next 12–18 months, and what measurable progress or impact are we aiming for?

9️⃣ External impact & visibility plan 🌍
How is the community planning to expand its visibility and impact with leaders and (corporate) senior managers beyond the community members in the long run?

🔟 Learning beyond coding 📚
Will there be continued opportunities for learning in other areas similar to the non-coding learning paths?

@everyone ❓ Vote for the questions you want <@1352785241252565174>  to answer during tomorrow’s live Q&A on LinkedIn at 11:00 AM EST!
https://www.linkedin.com/posts/gen-ai-global_get-an-insiders-view-of-how-gen-ai-global-activity-7331033018381254656-i6dI?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAACFrORUBBF3DiisJdFqFZOMEOHOcKgs0UYE

**Get an Insider’s View of Gen AI Global**

We’ll explore how Gen AI Global is scaling open-source innovation, community learning, and real-world impact.

📋 Please refer to the full list of questions below, each one corresponding to the number in the poll above.

1️⃣ Non-coders & learning paths 🧑‍🏫
What’s the plan for non-coders in the agent development class?
Any information that can be shared on that and learning paths planned for the community?

2️⃣ Community-building challenges 🧱
What has been the most challenging part of building this community?
Could you give us a brief explanation of how that challenge was addressed and resolved?

3️⃣ Member roles & responsibilities 🎯
Are there any options for existing General Members to take on new responsibilities or roles in the Community?

4️⃣ Future of the community 🔮
How is the community going to evolve, and how can we digest so much information shared by different groups?

5️⃣ Origin story of MIT GenAI 🌱
Dear Oscar, what sparked the idea to create the MIT Gen AI Community, and what key moment or need triggered you to turn that idea into reality?

6️⃣ ISO-like governance in AI 📜
In dynamic AI environments, how can we implement ISO-like governance frameworks (e.g. ISO/IEC 42001) without stifling agility and innovation?
What are key design patterns that balance certifiability with adaptiveness?

7️⃣ GenAI for employee productivity 👥
How can companies adopt Generative AI to enhance employee productivity and engagement — without creating fear of job displacement?

8️⃣ Multimodal AI ethics & cues 🧠
As AI-driven multimodal interfaces become more fluent and human-like, how can we ensure users don't mistake these systems' responses for true understanding or agency?
What ethical responsibilities arise in shaping the cues of collaboration and intelligence in such systems?

9️⃣ LLM + enterprise system integration 🧩
How complex is it to integrate LLM models with enterprise systems like CRMs, ERPs, or automation tools?
What tools are available to ensure traceability, explainability, and auditability?

🔟 AI agent validation & certification 🛡️
How do we validate the behavior of AI agents in production environments?
Is continuous evaluation more important than pre-deployment certification?

@everyone ❓ Vote for the questions you want Dr. Sanchez to ask at the Q&A tomorrow on GEN AI Global LInkedin at 11 AM EST.
https://www.linkedin.com/events/abel-john-fridayq-a-117328588672830771204/theater/


📋 Please refer to the full list of questions below, each one corresponding to the number indicated in the poll above.

1️⃣ AI brain drain & research exodus 🌍
With U.S. research funding cuts — especially from the DOGE — top scientists are leaving for better support abroad, accelerating a growing brain drain (Business Insider, May 2025).
Can AI meaningfully replace the loss of human scientific talent?
Could generative AI or autonomous research tools fill this gap — or are we overestimating what AI can do without the insight, creativity, and mentorship of human scientists?

2️⃣ Explainability as a system property 🧢
As generative AI systems scale and integrate across domains (from content to decision-making tools), should we rethink ‘explainability’ as a system-level property rather than a model feature?
What new patterns or architectural shifts could support end-to-end traceability and contextual reasoning in increasingly modular and agentic AI environments?

3️⃣ AI agent design debt risks ⚙️
As generative AI systems become increasingly agentic and capable of complex autonomous tasks, what design principles and architectural choices are essential to ensure maintainability and debuggability over time — especially to avoid the upfront efficiency gains being lost to long-term technical debt?

4️⃣ AI in healthcare ethics & trust 🏥
With the recent launch of China’s first AI hospital featuring 42 AI doctors, what are the potential ethical and practical challenges of AI-driven docs in our healthcare systems?
How can we ensure that AI doctors build trust, comply with regulations, and collaborate effectively with human healthcare providers?

5️⃣ AI resistance in the workplace 👨‍💼
What should management’s attitude be regarding employee resistance to AI?
Some companies are pushing AI-first strategies broadly — including tying AI usage to performance reviews. Is that the right way forward?

6️⃣ AI coding tools arms race ⚔️
With OpenAI’s Windsurf acquisition and Cursor’s rise, which AI coding tools should we be aware of in the coming “arms race”?

7️⃣ Generative AI vs human judgment ⚖️
How is generative AI reshaping the balance between human judgment and machine output in healthcare and finance, and what should leaders prioritize for ethical, effective adoption?

8️⃣ IBM/Amazon agent shift 🛠️
How do IBM’s and Amazon’s recent AI agent announcements reflect the shift toward autonomous, task-specific agents? What are the implications for enterprise ecosystems and human developers?

9️⃣ AI and the digital divide 🌐
Are we at risk of deepening inequality by creating an “AI Dividend” that primarily benefits the digitally empowered? How can AI bridge — not widen — the digital divide?

🔟 Open source security concerns 🔐
How can we increase adoption of open source models in corporations despite concerns around sensitive data and security?

1️⃣ Open source in enterprises 🏢
What are minimum or sensible guardrails, prerequisites, or requirements that enterprises should implement to foster the use of open source models and make decision makers more comfortable using them?

2️⃣ Multilingual AI inclusion 🌍
In a world where AI shapes global communication, how can we ensure multilingualism and digital inclusion are embedded in AI systems from the start? What frameworks, data partnerships, or design choices could support low-resource languages and diverse perspectives?

3️⃣ ISO-like governance in AI 📜
How can ISO-like frameworks (e.g. ISO/IEC 42001) be applied to AI without stifling innovation? What design patterns balance certifiability with adaptiveness in dynamic environments?

4️⃣ Autonomous AI agents in workflow 🤖
What should we consider when integrating AI agents that adapt to user workflows, collaborate with tools/people, and evolve over time in creative or technical systems?

5️⃣ Agentic value: orchestration or data? 🧠
With model capabilities leveling, where is the most defensible value in agent-based systems — orchestration, context management, proprietary data, or something else?

@everyone ❓ Vote for the questions you want Dr. Sanchez to ask at the Q&A tomorrow on Zoom at 11:30 AM — https://mit.zoom.us/j/97336834725 ✅

🔍 Due to the character limitations imposed by the poll, I was unable to include the complete text of each question.

📋 Kindly refer to the comprehensive list of questions provided below, each corresponding to the number indicated above.

1️⃣ As agents (and other tools) are increasingly employed in sensible environments (Social Security, Financial Services, Law Enforcement, …) and handle sensitive data (e.g., Agent Pay by Mastercard), will we eventually need minimum standards/criteria these agents/tools must meet, or should this be left entirely to market participants? If standards would be beneficial, what criteria/minimum quality benchmarks (transparency, fairness, registration, security, …) make sense, and which institutions could act as standard setters?

2️⃣ The EU AI Act is often criticized for weak enforcement. From a technical or architectural perspective, what innovations or system-level designs could make such regulations more enforceable in practice?

3️⃣ As generative AI models become more capable and autonomous, what governance frameworks or safeguards are essential to ensure responsible innovation without stifling creativity?

4️⃣ As domain-specific AI applications and niche-use-case start-ups rapidly multiply, how do you think this trend will influence or impact the future of GenAI for enterprises and for individuals?

5️⃣ Definition of teams in relation to AI — If AI continues to evolve as both tool and collaborator, how might this challenge our fundamental understanding of what constitutes a “team” in creative and technical contexts?

6️⃣ With the rise of agentic AI and more specialized models, how do you see the roles of large and small models evolving in enterprise AI architectures? Follow-up Q: What are the identified and potential risks and biases regarding unsupervised decisions made by AAI?

7️⃣ What are the standard best practices for designing AI systems with optimal memory utilization while minimizing computational and power overhead—especially in light of the growing concern around energy constraints and sustainability in large-scale AI deployments? I have been part of AI automation for a year and haven’t found the best capacity manager—many times, adjustments are made ad-hoc based on requirements.
